it.unibo.dtn.JAL

Class BPSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unibo.dtn.JAL.BPSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class BPSocket
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    This class represents a socket to send and receive bundles.

    A BPSocket is the sending or receiving point for a bundle delivery service. Each bundle sent or received on a datagram socket is individually addressed and routed. Multiple bundles sent from one machine to another may be routed differently, and may arrive in any order.

    Default settings
    Timeout 60 seconds
    Payload location Memory

    If you need to change the default settings of JALEngine you have to set those before creating a BPSocket.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andrea Bisacchi

        public void unregister()
                throws JALNotRegisteredException,
                       JALCloseErrorException,
                       JALUnregisterException
        Unregisters the BPSocket
        Throws:
        JALNotRegisteredException - - in case you are trying to unregister a not initialized socket
        JALCloseErrorException - - in case of errors on closing socket
        JALUnregisterException - - in case of other occurrences

      • receive

        public Bundle receive()
               throws JALNotRegisteredException,
                      JALTimeoutException,
                      JALReceptionInterruptedException,
                      JALReceiveException
        Receives a bundle from the BPSocket
        Returns:
        The bundle received
        Throws:
        JALNotRegisteredException - - in case you are trying to receive through a not initialized socket
        JALTimeoutException - - if timeout expires on waiting for a bundle
        JALReceptionInterruptedException - - in case the receive is interrupted (in the most cases it is just a warning)
        JALReceiveException - - in case of other occurrences

      • send

        public void send(Bundle bundle)
          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                 JALNullPointerException,
                 JALNotRegisteredException,
                 JALReceiverException,
                 JALSendException
        Sends a bundle through the BPSocket
        Parameters:
        bundle - The bundle to send
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - In case the expiration is <= 0 or the destination is invalid or the bundlePayload is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - In case the flags in StatusReport inside the bundle are setted but is not set the ReplyTo.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - - in case the bundle is null
        JALNullPointerException - - in case of null in some important internal bundle fields
        JALNotRegisteredException - - in case you are trying to send through a not initialized socket
        JALReceiverException - - in case the destination is not set
        JALSendException - - in case of other occurrences

      • register

        public static BPSocket register(int demuxIPN)
                         throws JALLocalEIDException,
                                JALOpenException,
                                JALIPNParametersException,
                                JALRegisterException
        Creates a BPSocket that can use only IPN scheme
        Parameters:
        demuxIPN - The demux token
        Returns:
        A registered BPSocket
        Throws:
        JALLocalEIDException - - in case errors occurs on building local EID
        JALOpenException - - in case errors occurs on opening the socket
        JALIPNParametersException - - in case the scheme is IPN and the demux number is negative (negative port are not supported)
        JALRegisterException - - in case of other occurrences
